title: Alcaraz bests Sinner to win US Open, sixth Slam
content: Carlos Alcaraz reasserted his superiority over Jannik Sinner with a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 win Sunday in the US Open final -- the third Grand Slam tournament in a row where these rivals met to decide the champion -- for his second title at Flushing Meadows.

title: Steelers' Rodgers shows Jets he still has it in win
content: Aaron Rodgers threw four touchdown passes Sunday to help the Steelers win their opener and show the Jets that he 'still can' play.

title: After early TD, Kittle exits with hamstring injury
content: 49ers tight end George Kittle will not return to Sunday's game against the Seahawks after suffering a hamstring injury in the second quarter.

title: McDaniel: Dolphins' woes in opener not all on Tua
content: Tua Tagovailoa wasn't good enough in the Dolphins' season-opening 33-8 loss Sunday to the Colts, but in his defense, no Dolphins player was. "Like the rest of the team, [his performance] wasn't good enough," coach Mike McDaniel said.

title: Illini, Noles crack AP top 10; USF enters at No. 18
content: Ohio State, Penn State and LSU lead the AP Top 25 college football poll, while Illinois and FSU cracked the top 10 and USF bullied its way into its first ranking in seven years.

title: Phils' Turner, NL hits leader, injures hamstring
content: Phillies star shortstop Trea Turner left Sunday's game against the Marlins after suffering a right hamstring strain while legging out a ground ball.

title: Ohtani's 2HRs bring struggling Dodgers to 'life'
content: Coming off an excruciating defeat that stretched their losing streak to five games, the Los Angeles Dodgers desperately needed a spark in the finale of a horrid East Coast trip.

title: Raleigh belts No. 53; M's club 5 HRs in 18-2 rout
content: Cal Raleigh his major-league-leading 53rd home run, and the Mariners had 20 hits and five HRs as they scored their most runs since 2012 in an 18-2 rout of Atlanta.

title: 👀 Best of NFL Week 1 arrivals and tunnel fits
content: NFL stars didn't just show up to play -- they showed up in style. From Joe Burrow to Jayden Daniels, here are the best looks from the first Sunday of the season.

title: Questions, takeaways off every NFL Week 1 game: Have the Colts found their QB? Is the Bengals offense doing enough?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 1.

title: True or false? What we think we know about SEC QBs, the Big 12, Oregon and more
content: The start of the 2025 season has been a delightful mess. Bill Connelly tries to make sense of what we've seen.

title: Cleveland Browns fans know how to keep the faith
content: The Dawg Pound has witnessed 30 years of futility. Will the team's bid for the burbs test the loyal fanbase?

title: Will Fever make playoffs? Can Liberty still host? Breaking down the WNBA playoff picture
content: Six teams have clinched WNBA playoff bids, but seeding and the last two berths still need to be determined.

title: Early-game headlines: Fields-Wilson combo shines
content: Liz Loza discusses the fantasy excitement the former Ohio State teammates generated, along with first impressions for notable rookies.

title: From Starkville to Gainesville, Week 2 offered its share of surprises
content: Florida and Mississippi State both produced stunning results on an otherwise relatively predictable Saturday.

title: Ranking the greatest moments of USWNT, NWSL star Alex Morgan's career ahead of her jersey retirement
content: Here are 13 moments -- in honor of the number she wore for a generation -- on the field that defined Alex Morgan's decade and a half playing at the highest level.

title: Everton beat Liverpool at Anfield to maintain WSL derby dominance
content: Everton manager Brian Sorensen has joked of Anfield being his team's "training pitch," and so it proved as they won 4-1 in Sunday's Merseyside derby.

title: U.S. loss to South Korea another misstep with World Cup prep time running out
content: You can say this for the USMNT: They're singing from the same songbook of positivity, even as they looked far from being on the same page on the field.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes from Kiper, Miller and Reid: Early concerns around top QBs?
content: John Mateer rising? Questions around LaNorris Sellers and Cade Klubnik? We have updates on NFL draft prospects through CFB Week 2.

title: After a cruelly disappointing year, Aryna Sabalenka proves why she's No. 1
content: Top-ranked Sabalenka lost twice in a major final earlier in the year. But at the US Open, she finally won another Grand Slam title.

title: Odds, trends and best bets for Ravens-Bills on 'Sunday Night Football'
content: Betting tips and all the info you need to help navigate betting Sunday night's big Ravens-Bills matchup.

title: Who's next? Tiering Hall of Fame chances for 50 active NBA stars
content: From top-75 locks to vets on the bubble, Zach Kram runs down the active NBA players on the path to Springfield.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City to rival Liverpool for Guéhi in January
content: Manchester City could go up against Liverpool for Crystal Palace defender Marc Guéhi in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 of the top women's transfers: Yohannes, Thompson, Clinton, more
content: The women's summer transfer window broke records and had some incredible moves. What were some of the best?

title: From No. 1 to ... the Rockies, again: Ranking all 30 MLB cores
content: Dodgers or Mariners? Mets or Phillies? We rank the clubs with the most star power under control through 2027.

title: How much will Tucker get? Who could sign Schwarber? Passan's early free agency intel
content: MLB front offices are already thinking ahead to the offseason. Here are the storylines that will rule the winter.

title: Taliban Restrictions Delay Medical Help For Women In Quake-Hit Areas: Report
content: The Taliban's response to women affected by the earthquake has been hindered by strict gender rules and cultural restrictions, New York Times reported.

title: Government Keeping "Good Watch" On Exchange Rates: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the government is keeping a 'good watch' on exchange rates, stressing that besides rupee several other currencies have depreciated against the US dollar.

title: Punjab Floods Death Count Rises To 48; Schools, Colleges To Reopen From Today
content: With two more persons losing their lives, the death count in Punjab due to devastating floods went up to 48 while crops on 1.76 lakh hectares have been damaged, said officials on Sunday.

title: 90% Of North Kashmir's Unmarked Graves Are Of 'Terrorists': Study
content: A new field study has challenged the long-standing "mass grave" narrative in north Kashmir, concluding that more than 90 per cent of the 4,056 unmarked graves investigated belong to foreign and local terrorists.

title: 5 Days After Breaching Danger Mark, Yamuna Water Level Recedes
content: The water level of the Yamuna at Delhi's Old Railway Bridge on Sunday fell to the danger mark of 205.33 metres, five days after it was breached, officials said.

title: 'NDA Dinner Meetings Cancelled To Express Solidarity With Flood Victims': Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that the planned dinner meetings of NDA MPs with PM Narendra Modi and BJP national president J.P. Nadda have been cancelled in solidarity with lakhs of people affected by the severe flooding across Northern India

title: Arvind Kejriwal Dares PM Modi To Impose 75% Tariff On US Imports To India
content: Aam Aadmi Party's convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to "show some courage" and impose 75 per cent tariff on imports from the US in response to its 50 per cent tariff on Indian exports.

title: India, EU Working To Seal Free Trade Agreement By December: Report
content: Eyeing to conclude their ambitious free trade deal soon, India and European Union will hold two rounds of crucial negotiations in next one month, authoritative sources said.

title: Water Reaches Walls Of Taj Mahal Due To Rising Yamuna Levels In Agra
content: The water levels in the Yamuna river rose further here on Sunday, exceeding the danger mark and reaching the walls of the Taj Mahal, officials said.

title: To Placate Disgruntled Thevars, EPS Seeks Bharat Ratna For Community Leader
content: In a significant political move aimed at consolidating support among the Thevar community, AIADMK chief Edappadi K Palaniswami or EPS has demanded Bharat Ratna for freedom fighter and community icon Pasumpon Muthuramalinga Thevar.

title: Monsoon Losses Exceed Rs 4,000 Crore In Himachal Pradesh: Officials
content: Himachal Pradesh has experienced losses totalling Rs 4,080 crore due to cloudbursts, flash floods, and landslides triggered by heavy rains from June 20 to September 7, officials said on Sunday.

title: 'Separatist Mindset Dominates DMK's Dravidian Model Of Politics': Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that the ruling DMK in Tamil Nadu is raising emotive issues around language and Dravidian identity to target the BJP as it has no answers to allegations of corruption and caste-crimes plaguing its governme

title: Wife, Her Lover Kill, Bury Kanpur Man, Skeleton Exhumed 10 Months Later
content: Ten months after a man was allegedly sedated, murdered with a pickaxe, and buried in the backyard of his Kanpur home, police on Sunday exhumed his skeletal remains and arrested his wife and her lover for the grisly crime.

title: Vice President Of India: Office With Perks, But No Regular Salary
content: The Vice President of India, the second-highest Constitutional office in the country, is perhaps the only post that does not enjoy the benefits of a regular salary.

title: Donald Trump Says Ready To Move On New Sanctions On Russia
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday said he was prepared to move forward on new sanctions on Moscow, hours after Russia fired its biggest-ever aerial barrage at Ukraine.

title: Thunderstorm, Rain Likely In Delhi On Monday
content: The national capital on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 34.4 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: "Love For Country Must Guide Your Choice": Opposition Veep Pick To MPs
content: In a fervent appeal to MPs ahead of the vice presidential polls, Opposition candidate B Sudershan Reddy exhorted them to not let party loyalty guide their choice.

title: UP Man Kills 80-year-old Mother After She Refuses Money For Alcohol
content: A man was arrested for allegedly killing his 80-year-old mother after she refused to give him money to buy liquor in Kasigawan village, Kanpur district, the police said on Sunday.

title: Farooq Abdullah Criticises Waqf Board For Hazratbal Row
content: National Conference president Farooq Abdullah on Sunday said the controversy at the Hazratbal shrine could have been avoided had the current Jammu and Kashmir Waqf Board not installed the plaque with the Ashoka emblem at the shrine

title: 27 RSS Activists Charged For Laying Floral Carpet In Kerala Temple
content: A case was registered against 27 RSS activists for laying a floral carpet at a temple in this district as part of Onam festivities, police said on Saturday.

title: Umar Khalid verdict raises questions about judicial discretion overruling bail even after long incarceration
content: Bail could be granted if a case was made out for the grant of bail and stringent conditions in the statute were satisfied

title: Nursing dreams held hostage
content: Despite court orders and official bans, private nursing colleges continue to trap students by withholding certificates and enforcing service bonds; PIL seeks regular inspections, grievance redressal mechanism

title: Walking a thin saffron line
content: RSS is a century old, and its chief Mohan Bhagwat wants to give it a makeover. But he is not sure how much, and how

title: First phase of teachers recruitment in exam in West Bengal held without any glitches
content: The total number of outstation candidates who appeared in the examination was more than 31,000. Another 2.46 lakh candidates will sit for the recruitment test of assistant teachers of classes XI and XII at 478 centres on September 14

title: Over 2.68L Ganesh idols immersed in 40-hour yatra across Hyderabad
content: Police register five cases of minor disputes, arrest 170 people for misbehaving with women and detained several others for picking pockets

title: Army Southern Command chief meets CM Revanth Reddy
content: The discussion was centered on issues concerning military-civil fusion, internal security, veteran welfare, disaster response and development initiatives

title: Sri Lankan Tamils not eligible for long-term visas
content: Although last week’s Home Ministry order removes the tag of an ‘illegal migrant’ from registered Sri Lankan Tamil nationals who entered India before January 9, 2015, it will not immediately help in grant of Indian citizenship

title: Congress MLA may ask Supreme Court to direct ECI to share data on poll fraud in his constituency with Karnataka CID
content: CID probing forged forms filed to delete voter names in Karnataka’s Aland constituency in 2023; ECI has not responded to requests for technical data; Congress chief says ECI is stonewalling to shield culprits

title: Veerashaiva Mahasabha urges Veerashaiva-Lingayats to enumerate themselves under ‘others’ in religion column
content: The Akhila Bharatha Veerashaiva Mahasabha on Sunday appealed to the Veerashaiva-Lingayats to enumerate themselves as ‘others’ instead of Hindu in the religion column during the socio-educational survey commencing on September 22

title: We demand accountability, answers and justice from Election Commission, says Karnataka Chief Minister
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, referring to The Hindu story on alleged voter fraud in Aland ahead of the Assembly polls in 2023 published on Sunday, said they demand ‘accountability, answers and justice’ from Election Commission of India

title: Bhupinder Hooda slams BJP govt. in Haryana over portal for flood-hit farmers to seek compensation
content: The Congress leader, on a visit to affected areas, demands immediate compensation even as Chief Minister Naib Singh Saini says the portal had been opened and the farmers would get the compensation soon.

title: Amidst tensions, India-Bangladesh Joint River Commission to meet on September 9
content: Bangladesh expected to ask for a special vehicle to manage the waters of 14 cross-border rivers, sources say; also seeks joint flood forecasting mechanism; Ganga treaty comes up for renewal next year

title: New documentary on late Bhupen Hazarika premiered
content: The documentary titled Bhupen da Uncut premieres ahead of birth centenary celebrations, featuring vintage footage and “unpublished” poems

title: ‘Vijayawada Utsav’ to be held from September 22
content: Hope the festival will attract investments, create jobs and will help Vijayawada transform into a major business hub, says MP Kesineni Sivanath

title: Dream of temple in Mathura will be fulfilled: BJP
content: The dream of the Ram Temple has been fulfilled, now it is the turn of Mathura-Vrindavan, says BJP on X

title:
Private beach resort penalised for excavating natural sand on seafront at 
Mamallapuram
content:
The Tamil Nadu State Coastal Zone Management Authority has decided to impose an ‘environment compensation’ of ₹2.60 
lakh on the resort on the East Coast Road after it was found to have excavated natural sand in the seafront area at Mamallapuram two years ago

title: Tourism Minister refutes YSRCP claims on medical college privatisation
content: Kandula Durgesh explains benefits of PPP model, says it will speed up construction, add MBBS seats, and keep colleges under government control; outlines phased expansion plans across the State

title: NC, PDP condemn ‘detention of locals’ over Hazratbal incident
content: BJP says ‘vandalism unacceptable’; the issue was being ‘institutionally distorted to represent a twisted litmus test for nationalism’, NC leader and MP Aga Syed Ruhullah said

title: MSMEs ‘key to self-reliant India’, it’s an ‘opportune time’ to engage in defence sector: DRDO chief
content: Dr. Samir V. Kamat was speaking at a conclave organised by the Defence Technology and Test Centre (DTTC), Lucknow, at its Amausi campus to promote collaboration with industry for the Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor.

title: NDA, INDIA blocs to train MPs on voting procedure for Vice-President election
content: The BJP begins two-day workshop on Sunday, with PM Modi sitting at the venue for the entire day. The INDIA bloc will hold a mock polling session for its MPs on Monday. Both blocs cancel plan to host MPs for dinner, considering the flood situation in many States

title: India cautions against misuse of export measures at SCO trade Ministers’ meet
content: At the SCO Trade Ministers' Meeting in Vladivostok, Russia on September 6, India said that calibrated and transparent use of these steps is essential to maintain trust in international commerce

title: CPI(M) accuses KPCC digital cell of throwing a lifeline to the BJP by correlating ‘Beedis and Biharis’
content: The comment threatens to retard the political momentum gained by the INDIA bloc’s 16-day Voter Adhikari Yatra, led by Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav, against ‘voter list fraud’ ahead of the Bihar polls, says Rajesh

title: Conversations over judges’ appointment, 130th Constitutional amendment dominate SRM law symposium
content: ‘A 31-day arrest amounts to letting a constable nullify the essence of electoral democracy,’ senior advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi said on the Bill seeking the removal of MPs or MLAs if they were imprisoned for 30 days

title: NHRC notice to Madhya Pradesh officials over death of infants after rat bites at Indore hospital
content: “Such a lapse not only breaches the trust of citizens in public healthcare but also constitutes a serious violation of the Right to Life and Health under Article 21 of the Constitution,” says the rights panel

title: Thin vote margins in the past make Opposition wary of SIR in Bihar
content: As per ADR data, in the 2020 Assembly election, the winning margin was under 1% or less than 3,000 votes in 35 seats. It was less than 5,000 votes in 52 seats. RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav had recently said that the results in about 35 seats could be affected in the upcoming election if even just 1% of the voters are removed from the rolls through the SIR.

title: SNDP Yogam accuses UDF of turning its back on Sabarimala development
content: He accuses Satheesan of conducting a “live dress rehearsal” as the next Chief Minister of the State without showing the statesmanship qualities required for the top post

title: GST irony plays out in Onam market as consumers postpone purchase plans
content: Many consumers postpone purchase plans anticipating a price fall once the GST revision comes into effect from September 22. Key traders in the State say they saw a dip in customer footfall during Onam, a season  when sales normally peak

title: NDA will form the government in Bihar once again, says Nitish
content: The Bihar CM asserted that rapid development is taking place in all areas and special attention has been given to education and health sectors

title: Hydrotherapy pool at rehabilitation centre near Tiruchi helps rescued elephants cool off
content: The pool is meant to provide muscle relaxation for aged captive elephants suffering from pain and weakness in their legs. The elephants are led to the pool by their mahouts in the morning, and spend about an hour in the water, says an official

title: Punjab floods leave farmers stranded between two seasons
content: Farm outfits say 30% of State’s paddy crop has been ruined, with the floods leaving the land unsuitable for sowing winter wheat as well; demand compensation of ₹70,000 per acre, loan waivers

title: Row over land acquisition resurfaces as Devanahalli farmers resume their protest
content: The trigger for farmers’ protest is the KIADB’s attempt to resume acquisition process by issuing notices in two villages asking them to attend a meeting to fix compensation for their lands

title: Over eight lakh youths given government jobs, says U.P. CM Adityanath
content: The CM says that now recruitment processes are transparent and merit-based, unlike in previous regimes where “so much money was taken that they could not even look into the eyes of candidates”

title: Government employees seek DA as Dasara gift
content: The DA, which should have been announced and offered once in six months, has turned out to be a distant dream, says APNGGOA President

title: Review plea in SC challenges norms on posting of consumer commission office-bearers
content: Petition filed by Parivarthan challenges the May 21 apex court judgment on the Consumer Protection Rules, 2020 on the appointment and other aspects of the president and members of the State and District Consumer Commissions

title: Kochi police leave for Mumbai to take director into custody
content: Sanalkumar Sasidharan detained in Mumbai airport after a lookout circular was issued against him for alleged harassment of woman actor on social media

title: Man held for ‘misleading’ social media post on HNSS canal
content: Acting on a complaint from the HNSS officials, the Kuppam police crack down on the false claim, which went viral, creating confusion in the agrarian belt

title: KTR blames govt. for sanitation worker’s death at Mulugu, demands aid
content: Assures bereaved family of help from BRS cites non-payment of wages for 6 months as reason for driving worker to extreme step

title: Drunk driving kills a 20-year-old student, injures seven others after car rams police vehicle at Langer Houz
content: All five occupants of the car had been drinking before the crash; the injured include four passengers in the car and three policemen

title: Efforts under way to provide basic facilities on city outskirts in a phased manner, says G.T. Deve Gowda
content: Efforts will be made to gradually provide the basic infrastructure facilities to the residents of these localities as part of the overall development of Chamundeshwari Assembly constituency, says the MLA

title: No dearth of urea in Kurnool district, says Collector
content: Ranjith Basha warns of severe action against those who hoard urea or sell it above the designated price, and assures onion farmers that they will get ₹1,200 per quintal for their produce brought to the market yard

title: Arunachal: Anti-dam activist stopped from flying to Dublin; police cite LOC tied to trespass
content: Activist Bhanu Tatak was prevented from flying to Dublin due to a lookout circular linked to two police cases: criminal trespass in 2021 and defacing a mural in 2022. Police deny the action is related to her opposition to the Siang dam project, while the Youth Congress condemns it as suppression of dissent against the government.

title: US Open: Alcaraz beats Sinner to win sixth major title; reclaims top ranking
content: Carlos Alcaraz won against Jannik Sinner in the US Open final in New York. Alcaraz claimed his second US Open title and sixth Grand Slam championship. This victory allows Alcaraz to reclaim the world number one ranking. Former President Donald Trump attended the match, drawing mixed reactions. Alcaraz dominated the match, winning in four sets.

title: Taliban back upgrade in ties as India explores ministerial visit
content: Amid ongoing efforts, the Taliban have expressed support for strengthened ties with India, suggesting high-level visits, including one from Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi. India is seeking a UNSC waiver for Muttaqi's travel ban to facilitate the visit, which aims to explore cooperation and trade.

title: US state dept changes rules; Indians can’t seek faster interviews abroad anymore
content: The US State Department has updated its instructions, requiring non-immigrant visa applicants to schedule interviews in their country of citizenship or legal residence. This change impacts Indians who previously sought quicker appointments abroad due to long wait times in India. Exceptions exist for countries where the US doesn't conduct routine NIV operations, designating specific embassies for those nationalities.

title: US recession: Moody’s warns average Americans, these states are at risk
content: Mark Zandi of Moody's warns that the US economy is nearing recession, with states comprising a third of the nation's GDP at high risk. Sluggish consumer spending, tariffs, and housing market struggles contribute to this vulnerability. Revised job reports reveal a hiring slowdown, adding to concerns about rising inflation and eroding consumer purchasing power.

title: Asia Cup: India crush South Korea 4-1 to lift fourth title, qualify for Hockey World Cup
content: India showcased a dominant performance, defeating defending champions South Korea 4-1 in Rajgir to secure their fourth Asia Cup hockey title. This victory not only marked a return to continental supremacy after eight years but also guaranteed their qualification for the 2026 Hockey World Cup. Dilpreet Singh's outstanding performance earned him the Player of the Match award.

title: India-EU ramp up ties; high-level visits lined up to boost FTA talks
content: The EU is set to unveil its strategic agenda with India on September 17, aiming to strengthen partnership in technology, trade, and security. Both sides are intensifying efforts to finalize a free trade agreement by year-end, with negotiations ongoing. High-level engagements are planned to boost cooperation in counterterrorism and the Indo-Pacific region ahead of the India-EU summit next year.

title: Red Sea cables cut: Microsoft shares update; services affected in these regions
content: Microsoft resolved Azure cloud platform issues after Red Sea subsea cable cuts caused latency and service disruptions in the Middle East and Asia. The company rerouted traffic to minimize impact, and services are now operational. While repairs continue, Microsoft is monitoring and optimizing routing to reduce customer impact, as the cable cuts affected internet connectivity in multiple countries.

title: J&K: Police detain 50 people over Hazratbal shrine emblem row
content: Following the defacement of a national emblem plaque inside Srinagar's Hazratbal shrine, authorities have detained nearly 50 people for questioning, sparking political controversy. Opposition parties criticize the plaque's installation as provocative, while the BJP defends it and accuses the National Conference of exploiting the situation. Security has been tightened around the shrine as investigations continue into the vandalism.

title: Ukraine war: Trump says US ready for phase-2 sanctions on Russia; follows Moscow’s biggest strike
content: Following Russia's largest aerial assault on Ukraine, which resulted in casualties and significant damage in Kyiv, US President Donald Trump has affirmed his readiness to impose a second phase of sanctions on Russia. President Zelenskyy strongly condemned the attacks, labeling them a deliberate act of war. European leaders, including Macron and Starmer, have also voiced their condemnation of the strikes.

title: Kylie Kelce’s daughters: Life as a mom; Jason Kelce shares parenting joy
content: Kylie Kelce and Jason Kelce have four daughters named Wyatt, Elliotte, Bennett and Finnley. The Kelce family includes parenting in their documentary series. Wyatt is known for her energy at Eagles games. Elliotte shares the family's love for time together. Bennett was born after Jason's Super Bowl appearance. Kylie shares the challenges and joys of raising four young children.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: Cop dies, 2 missing as MP police vehicle plunges into river
content: In a tragic incident near Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, the in-charge of Unhel police station, Ashok Sharma, died after their vehicle plunged into the Kshipra river while searching for a missing woman. Sub-inspector Madanlal Ninama and woman constable Arti Pal are still missing as rescue operations continue.

title: GST reforms 2025: Now, companies don't need to match credit notes to invoices
content: The GST Council has eased compliance for businesses, particularly FMCG companies, by removing the requirement to link credit notes to specific invoices. This change addresses a long-standing pain point, especially for products with short shelf lives, and aligns GST provisions with standard business practices.

title: US Open: Trump's visit to New York results in delays and queues; booed by crowd
content: Donald Trump's attendance at the US Open men's final was met with boos and caused security delays, leading to long lines and missed match time for some spectators. Trump's presence drew mixed reactions, with booing intensifying when he appeared on the big screen.

title: Sports: Phillies dad explains giving Bader HR ball to Cheryl Richardson Wagner
content: In Miami, Drew Feltwell's son, Lincoln, received a home run ball. A Phillies fan demanded it back. Drew gave it up to avoid problems. Marlins staff gifted Lincoln a goodie bag. Phillies player Harrison Bader gave him a signed bat. The woman's identity was shared online. However, claims about her were untrue.

title: 'The Summer I Turned Pretty': Lauren Kyle shares her take on the movie
content: Lauren Kyle, wife of Edmonton Oilers captain Connor McDavid, gave fans a glimpse into her evening with an Instagram Story about The Summer I Turned Pretty. The post comes just months after McDavid’s run to the 2025 Stanley Cup Finals and Kyle’s June launch of Bar Trove in Edmonton. The couple’s public support for each other continues to stand out.

title: Aryna Sabalenka’s new boyfriend: Who is Georgios Frangulis?
content: Aryna Sabalenka found solace and support in Brazilian entrepreneur Georgios Frangulis following the tragic loss of her ex-boyfriend. Their relationship became public in spring 2024, with Frangulis becoming a constant presence in her player's box. Beyond his support, Frangulis is the founder of Oakberry, an açaí-based brand for which Sabalenka is an ambassador.

title: Toraya Reid killed: Naz Reid’s sister shot; NJ man faces murder charge
content: Toraya Reid, the elder sister of Minnesota Timberwolves forward Naz Reid, tragically lost her life in a fatal shooting outside a New Jersey apartment complex. Shaquille Green, her boyfriend, has been arrested and charged with murder. The incident occurred on Saturday morning at the Paragon Apartment complex in Jackson Township.

title: 'Total collapse': Trump aide seeks more tariffs over Russia oil; asks EU to join
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent has urged the European Union to join the US in increasing pressure on Russia, hinting at potential tariffs on nations buying Russian oil. The Trump administration has already imposed significant tariffs on India for its Russian oil trade.

title: 'India has nothing to apologise': Tharoor slams Trump aide
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor defended India's mature approach amid US criticism over Russian oil imports, highlighting that other nations, including those in Europe and China, have larger economic ties with Russia. He cautioned against overlooking Trump's tariff threats and insults despite softened rhetoric, emphasising the real consequences faced by Indians.

title: Fever vs Mystics: Odds & spread; Top WNBA prop bets and prediction
content: On September 7, 2025, the Indiana Fever are heavily favored against the Washington Mystics at CFG Bank Arena. Betting odds strongly suggest a Fever victory, driven by their superior record, offensive efficiency, and key player performances, particularly from Kelsey Mitchell. While the Mystics' home advantage and rookie talent offer some intrigue, experts predict the Fever will likely cover the spread.

title: 'So this is your respect for farmers': JD(S) slams Kharge for his 'I planted 40 acres' rebuke
content: JDS criticized Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge for dismissing a farmer's grievances about crop damage in Kalaburagi. JDS accused Kharge of arrogance, stating that Congress only cares about farmers in speeches. In a clip from Kharge's Kalaburagi house, Kharge was seen claiming that his own crop loss was worse and accused the farmer of seeking publicity.

title: Inside Hyundai raid: How a monthlong op led US immigration to Georgia plant
content: A large-scale immigration raid at a Hyundai-LG battery plant in Georgia led to the detention of hundreds, including over 300 South Korean workers, sparking diplomatic concerns and scrutiny of visa practices. The operation, targeting unlawful employment, halted construction at the multibillion-dollar EV battery project.

title: Heaviest defeat in ODI history! England break India's record as South Africa crumble
content: England inflicted a historic defeat on South Africa in Southampton, securing a record 342-run victory in the third ODI. Jofra Archer's fiery spell and Jacob Bethell's maiden century powered England to a massive 414/5, while South Africa crumbled to a mere 72 all out.

title: England pile 414 runs vs South Africa; Joe Root's heartfelt gesture steals the show - Watch
content: Joe Root's century and heartwarming gesture of gifting his batting gloves to a young fan stole the show during England's match against South Africa. Jacob Bethell's maiden international century and Jos Buttler's explosive innings further contributed to England's impressive 414-5 total.

title: Crisis in Japan? Shigeru Ishiba steps down as PM – what led to it and what’s next
content: Shigeru Ishiba, the Japanese Prime Minister, resigned due to pressure from his party after election losses. He cited progress in US tariff negotiations as the reason for his departure. The Liberal Democratic Party will hold a leadership contest to choose a successor. Sanae Takaichi and Shinjiro Koizumi are potential candidates.

title: 'He realised India won't surrender': Ex-envoy on Trump’s tone shift; takes dig
content: Former diplomat KP Fabian criticised Donald Trump's tariffs on India. He called them baseless. Trump seems to realize India won't surrender to trade threats. India seeks friendship but resists dictation. Trump softened his tone, calling India-US ties 'very special'. Prime Minister Narendra Modi reciprocated warmly. He highlighted the strong partnership between the two nations.

title: VP polls: B Sudarshan Reddy urges MPs for support; calls it a vote for ‘soul of India’
content: INDIA bloc's Vice-Presidential candidate, B Sudarshan Reddy, has appealed to members of parliament to prioritize national interest over party affiliations in the upcoming election. He urged them to vote thoughtfully, emphasizing that the decision would impact the nation's soul. Reddy expressed his readiness to accept the outcome, framing it as a collective responsibility to strengthen the republic.

title: Manipur pact: Kuki groups warn against 'free passage' after NH-2 reopening
content: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Tua Tagovailoa vs Colts: Injury update sparks doubt; Dolphins QB status
content: Tua Tagovailoa will play in the Miami Dolphins’ Week 1 matchup against the Indianapolis Colts despite past injury concerns. The quarterback confirmed his readiness, while Tyreek Hill is also expected to suit up. Get the latest injury update, game details, and what to expect from Miami’s offense in their season opener at Lucas Oil Stadium.

title: 'Four IPL teams for UP': CM Yogi Adityanath cheekily appeals to BCCI; gives strong reason
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has appealed to the BCCI to allocate more IPL teams to the state, emphasising its large population and improving sports infrastructure. Speaking at the UPT20 League closing ceremony, he argued that UP, with its 25 crore population, deserves at least four IPL teams.

title: Nearly half of Indian diaspora lives in just 10 countries! US tops list - details
content: India's diaspora, the world's largest at 3.43 crore, is significantly concentrated in ten countries, with the US and UAE leading. While the Gulf region remains a hub for NRIs, PIOs are largely based in Western nations. Remittances from the diaspora hit a record $135.46 billion, highlighting their economic impact.

title: Tyrese Haliburton’s note: Shares message with fiancée, recalls Iowa State roots
content: Tyrese Haliburton, recovering from a torn Achilles, revisited his Iowa State roots with fiancée Jade Jones, whom he met at the university. Celebrating Iowa State's victory over Iowa, Haliburton playfully suggested retiring Jones's cheerleading poms. The couple, who began dating in 2019, share a strong connection to their alma mater, where Haliburton honed his basketball skills.

title: Rain fury: Floods rip into Punjab's dwindling green cover, 5 lakh trees uprooted
content: Devastating floods in Punjab have significantly hampered efforts to expand the state's diminishing green cover, resulting in the loss of 4,94,956 trees across 776 hectares. With forest cover already low at 3.7% of its geographical area, the floods have deepened Punjab's ecological stress and caused an estimated damage of over Rs 360.5 lakh to the forest and wildlife preservation department.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Arshdeep Singh set to make history; huge T20I milestone awaits
content: Arshdeep Singh is on the cusp of becoming the first Indian bowler to claim 100 T20I wickets at the upcoming Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai. India's campaign starts on September 10 against the UAE, followed by a high-stakes match against Pakistan on September 14. The squad includes Surya Kumar Yadav as captain and Shubman Gill as vice-captain.

title: GST 2.0 savings: Price cuts across all major brands - Creta, Thar, Nexon & more
content: The implementation of GST 2.0 has led to significant price reductions across the Indian auto sector, with car manufacturers passing on the benefits to consumers. Savings range from Rs 65,000 to Rs 8.9 lakh, impacting models from Mahindra, Tata, Toyota, Skoda, Renault, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Hyundai.

title: AP Week 2 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
